docs.snippet: COINCIDENTALLY with the cutting of nearly three hours by the Lindberghs from the transcon  tinental speed record--a forerunner of twelve-hour mail service between the Atlantic and Pacific--comes the starting of a seven-day mail service ...
docs.lead_paragraph: COINCIDENTALLY with the cutting of nearly three hours by the Lindberghs from the transcon tinental speed record--a forerunner of twelve-hour mail service between the Atlantic and Pacific--comes the starting of a seven-day mail service ...

headline.main: SEVEN-DAY MAIL OPENS BETWEEN TWO AMERICAS; Flying Colonel Starts Service Which Will Link Republics by Way of West Coast and Supplement East Coast Facilities--Country-Wide Coordination Air Mail Plays Big Part. Europe Plans Fast Service.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, April 26.--Edward J. Sparks of New York City, Consul at valparaiso, Chile, has been confirmed as a secretary in the Diplomatic Service and designated Third Secretary of the Embassy at Santiago, Chile.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, April 26.--Edward J. Sparks of New York City, Consul at valparaiso, Chile, has been confirmed as a secretary in the Diplomatic Service and designated Third Secretary of the Embassy at Santiago, Chile.
docs.abstract: Designated 3rd Sec of U S Embassy at Santiago, Chile

headline.main: MANY CHANGES MADE IN FOREIGN SERVICE; E.J. Sparks and H.M. Wolcott of New York City Among Those Put in New Posts. VICE CONSULS PROMOTED American Business Man in Bangkok Appointed Honorary Vice Consul to Serve In Emergency.

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: Sen approves terms of $17,0000,000 loan from N Y bankers; $10,000,000 to be taken at once and $7,000,000 to be held over until settlement of question whether Govt or Bank of the Republic should pay interest on it
docs.abstract: Sen approves terms of $17,0000,000 loan from N Y bankers; $10,000,000 to be taken at once and $7,000,000 to be held over until settlement of question whether Govt or Bank of the Republic should pay interest on it

headline.main: URUGUAYAN SENATE APPROVES LOAN TERMS; Only $10,000,000 to Be Taken Now of $17,000,000 to Be Advanced by New York Bankers.

byline.original: Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: HAVANA, April 26 (AP).--Completing in 2 hours and 3 minutes the first leg of an inaugural air mail flight from Miami across the Caribbean Sea to the Canal Zone, Colonel Charles A. Lindbergh landed at the Pan-American Airways field at 5:36 o'clock...
docs.lead_paragraph: HAVANA, April 26 (AP).--Completing in 2 hours and 3 minutes the first leg of an inaugural air mail flight from Miami across the Caribbean Sea to the Canal Zone, Colonel Charles A. Lindbergh landed at the Pan-American Airways field at 5:36 o'clock this afternoon.
docs.abstract: Feature article on Pan-Amer Airways 7-day service, inaugurated by Lindbergh

headline.main: LINDBERGH LANDS MAIL AT HAVANA; Colonel Will Span Caribbean Today on Way to Nicaragua in Next Leg of Flight. DUE AT CANAL AT 6 P.M. Mail Will Then Be Taken Over the West Coast of South America on Journey to Buenos Aires. Starts Third Flight of Kind. Radio Stations to Link Plane.

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, April 26.--Uruguay appears likely to join those countries which are trying to relieve their producers from the operation of the laws of supply and demand by artificially keeping prices up by the government's purchasing the excess...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, April 26.--Uruguay appears likely to join those countries which are trying to relieve their producers from the operation of the laws of supply and demand by artificially keeping prices up by the government's purchasing the excess production.
docs.abstract: Natl Council approves plan of Govt purchase of surplus

headline.main: URUGUAY FAVORS PLAN TO RELIEVE FARMERS; National Council Approves Scheme for Purchase by Government of Surplus Corn.

byline.original: Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

headline.main: $10,000,000 IN GOLD HERE FROM BRAZIL; Equal Amount Due Today, Making Total $35,000,000 for Week,$57,700,000 on Movement.$3,600,000 FROM JAPANSan Francisco Gets Shipment--Gain of $57,000,000 for Country In April,$194,000,000 Since Jan. 1.
